alumni.bio: Alex Johnson has become a prominent voice in contemporary Caribbean music, blending traditional Bahamian folk songs with modern R&B and jazz influences. Since graduating from CAPAS, Alex has performed at major festivals across the Caribbean and has released two critically acclaimed albums that celebrate Bahamian musical heritage.
achievements: Winner of Caribbean Music Awards 2022
Soloist with Bahamas National Symphony
Recording artist with 2 platinum albums
Featured performer at Caribbean Festival of Arts
alumni.testimonial: CAPAS gave me the technical foundation and cultural grounding I needed to find my authentic voice as a Caribbean artist. The faculty didn't just teach me to sing—they taught me to honor my heritage through music.
careerPath: 2020: Backup vocalist for regional touring acts
2021: Solo recording contract with Caribbean Music Group
2022: Lead vocalist with Bahamas National Youth Orchestra

alumni.bio: Maria Fernandez has emerged as one of the Caribbean's most innovative choreographers, creating works that blend traditional Caribbean movement with contemporary dance techniques. Her choreography has been featured in major dance festivals and she regularly teaches workshops throughout the region.
achievements: Principal dancer with Caribbean Contemporary Dance Company
Choreographer for major Caribbean festivals
Recipient of Young Choreographer Award 2023
Featured in Dance Magazine Caribbean Edition
alumni.testimonial: The dance program at CAPAS taught me to honor traditional Caribbean movement while finding my own contemporary voice. Professor Hamilton showed me that authenticity and innovation can coexist beautifully.
careerPath: 2020: Corps member, Caribbean Contemporary Dance Company
2023: Founding choreographer for new works division

alumni.bio: David Thompson has become a leading voice in Caribbean theatre, directing productions that explore contemporary Bahamian stories while preserving traditional theatrical forms. His work focuses on community engagement and developing local theatrical talent.
achievements: Artistic Director of Nassau Community Theatre
Director of 15+ professional productions
Founder of Young Artists Theatre Workshop
Recipient of Caribbean Theatre Excellence Award
alumni.testimonial: CAPAS gave me more than theatrical training—it gave me a mission. Professor Mitchell taught me that Caribbean theatre can be both deeply rooted in tradition and boldly contemporary.
careerPath: 2018: Assistant director at local theatre company
2021: Associate Artistic Director, Nassau Community Theatre

alumni.bio: Sophia Williams has become a master of Caribbean percussion, specializing in steel drum and traditional instruments. She leads her own ensemble and has developed innovative educational programs that introduce Caribbean music to students across the region.
achievements: Leader of award-winning steel drum ensemble
Music educator in 5 Caribbean countries
Creator of 'Caribbean Rhythms' educational program
Featured performer at Crop Over Festival
alumni.testimonial: Master Clarke taught me that the steel drum is more than an instrument—it's a voice for our culture. CAPAS showed me how to share that voice with the world.

alumni.bio: Michael Brown discovered his calling for music ministry through CAPAS's part-time program. While maintaining his career as an accountant, he has become a respected church musician and community choir director, bringing professional-level music to his congregation and community.
achievements: Music Director at major Nassau church
Director of 3 community choirs
Organizer of annual Gospel Music Festival
Mentor to 20+ young musicians
alumni.testimonial: The part-time program at CAPAS allowed me to pursue my passion for music while maintaining my career. The training I received has enriched my life and my entire community.

alumni.bio: Isabella Martinez is passionate about bringing theatre education to young people. As a high school theatre teacher, she has developed innovative curricula that connect students with their Caribbean heritage while building confidence and creative expression skills.
achievements: Theatre Arts Teacher at prestigious high school
Director of award-winning student productions
Developer of Caribbean Theatre Curriculum
Youth Theatre Workshop leader
alumni.testimonial: CAPAS taught me that theatre is a powerful tool for education and personal growth. Now I get to share that gift with the next generation of Caribbean students.

alumni.bio: Jason Williams has built a successful music production business, working with artists across the Caribbean and North America. His steel drum and percussion expertise brings authentic Caribbean sounds to international recording projects.
achievements: Founder of successful music production company
Producer for Grammy-nominated albums
Session musician for major recording artists
Creator of Caribbean Music Sample Library
alumni.testimonial: CAPAS gave me world-class training in Caribbean music traditions. That authentic foundation has been the key to my success in the international music industry.

alumni.bio: Alicia Roberts has achieved international recognition as an operatic soprano, performing leading roles with opera companies throughout the Caribbean and North America. She is known for bringing Caribbean musical elements into classical opera performances.
achievements: Principal soprano with Caribbean Opera Company
Guest artist with international opera houses
Winner of International Vocal Competition 2023
Advocate for Caribbean representation in classical music
alumni.testimonial: Professor Dash taught me that my Caribbean heritage is a strength in classical music, not something to hide. CAPAS gave me the confidence to be authentically myself on the world's great stages.

alumni.bio: Christopher Wilson has transitioned from theatre to screen, appearing in major television productions and films. He brings the depth and authenticity of his Caribbean theatre training to contemporary screen acting roles.
achievements: Recurring role on major television series
Featured in 5 independent films
SAG-AFTRA member and advocate
Mentor for Caribbean actors entering film industry
alumni.testimonial: The character development and authenticity I learned at CAPAS has been invaluable in my screen career. Professor Mitchell taught me to find truth in every role.
careerPath: 2020: Moved to Atlanta for film opportunities

alumni.bio: Gabriella Johnson has created a thriving dance academy that serves students from ages 3 to adult. Her studio specializes in Caribbean dance forms while also offering contemporary and classical training, making dance accessible to the entire Freeport community.
achievements: Founder and owner of successful dance academy
Teacher to 150+ students annually
Organizer of annual community dance showcase
Youth dance competition judge
alumni.testimonial: Professor Hamilton taught me that dance can transform communities. My studio is my way of sharing that transformation with young people throughout Grand Bahama.
